main.p: Code generation and debugging.
Although tbf it's less "better than ChatGPT" and more "I can keep doing this without having to wait until next Wednesday"
I give 4o, o1, Claude 3.5 Sonnett and Deepseek the same prompts.

In prompts releated to research, ChatGPT is the best by far, followed by DeepSeek. Claude is the worst but mainly because it can't search the internet. Without searching, DeepSeek takes the last place easily.
In terms of writing and explaining Claude takes the cake, DeepSeek and ChatGPT are about par.
In terms of code-related use cases, IMO Claude = Deepseek = o1 > 4o

I give Deepseek R1 a prompt or a pain point that needs a solution in R or Python, it gives me exactly what I need. o1 will give me what I need but may miss dependencies or skip some important steps and likes to overcomplicate things. Claude needs more handholding and multiple iterations, but it does the iterations better and overall tends to write more robust code than o1 and 4o. But again for me it needs more handholding.
Deepseek just gives something workable, straight up, where ChatGPT may overly complicate and Claude overly simplify.
True. Codes written by Deepseek is just better and typically just one shots it.
it does i tested it on web development chat gpt 03 mini high could not do a better job then deepseekr1

I don't know that one is "better" than the other. Though I currently have an ongoing "conversation" with both AI models. If I had to state in my opinion based off of these conversations which one was superior to the other, per deepseeks understanding ChatGpt reins supreme.

Deepseek seems to often try and dodge questions and when a question was "maybe too complex" for it to provide an immediate it response it feigned a too busy server. Though immediately responded to my next comment of "really?" With a response to my initial question.

Deepseek seems to explain things much more robotically, where chatgpt articulates more naturally, chatgpt also seems to generally be more objective to "what if" or philosophical type questions than deepseek in my expirience.
Based on deepseeks own analysis of itself compared to chatgpt where it possibly excells is within its current level of customization, the degree to which I'm far from knowledgeable on.
Anywho...yerp. this is just my thoughts on what I've observed so far, maybe like 4 hours in discussions with both systems though ive been using chatgpt for some time.
It's better than any free ChatGPT model, and any Claude.
I need the reasoning capabilities, mainly since it just writes better code.

Not sure if people are necessarily saying deepseek is smarter. The buzz is over the claim that it is 10 to 20 times cheaper to run. Deepseek on the other hand seems to do great so far, feels smarter and more reliable for code lessons compared to the urgent chatgpt. Idk something happened Jan 29th that destroyed the memory and logic in gpt and they haven't been able to revert back properly.
